intro: Tocoyena microdon, commonly known as the dwarf tocoyena, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its striking appearance. Tocoyena microdon prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
